alert.note: Alert for Eastern Essex; Eastern King and Queen; Western Essex; Western King and Queen (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 16 at 4:32PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern King and Queen and southeastern Essex Counties through 515 PM EDT... At 432 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Saint Stephens Church, moving east southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Tappahannock, Saint Stephens Church, Millers Tavern, Stevensville, Dunnsville, Howertons, Upright, Biscoe, Crouch, Henley Fork, Brays Fork, Bruington and Dunbrooke. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Essex; Eastern King and Queen; Western Essex; Western King and Queen
